intro: Tabaroa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing perennial, often forming dense clusters of foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and blue, making it a popular ornamental plant. Tabaroa thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
